Oh for fuck's sake. Let's just put this all out there.

No one tried to stop you from killing Kuan Ti. In fact, we wanted you to use a skill (that we later found out you didn't have), to verify whether he was actually mush or not so we could bring you weapons so you could kill his mushy ass. When you stopped responding completely, there was discussion among a few of us in in-game PMs to play good cop/bad cop to try to get you to do *something* since your seeming unwillingness to torture Kuan Ti made it look a little like you were mush. Especially after your bloodthirsty introductory post.

We finally found out that you didn't have torture (which is fine) but then without much of a word to anyone that was trying to coordinate with you, you ran off into the same room as the mush and never said a thing. After that, we asked Chun to go in and use her premonition skill (which hurts her instead of the mush which is why it wasn't our first choice) to verify that Kuan Ti was a mush and lo and behold he was. So that's when I took off with the weapons (that I had offered repeatedly to bring to you so you could kill the dude) and came up to kill Kuan Ti. No one wanted you to not kill Kuan Ti, we wanted you to communicate and kill Kuan Ti. I would much rather have spent my APs getting glory against hunters than killing a mush.

After all of that when you "almost had him" with 4 misses and 2 hits with your bare fists (which don't do all that much damage), all you would have done is piss off a mush and invite him to really screw shit up... up to and including body swapping with someone else. So yeah, I killed him so he couldn't cause more chaos.

Fodgy and I are friends. It's not secret and it's very easy to identify each other when we end up together. But it's very definitely not "pretty much mush only" that buddy up on these ships. Ask your roommate. Neither he nor I were ever mush on a ship together and were pretty buddy buddy.

I wasn't involved in "the healing of the mush" so I can't speak from first hand experience on this one, but yeah, Chun probably should have administered the serum. *If* Frieda had been mush, that would have been one hell of an awesome play. But if you would take a step back and think about her actions for the duration of the ship, she did nothing other than help organize everyone and get work going on projects and research. That's not only the antithesis of a mush, it's flat out against the rules of playing a mush.

So yeah, one of your points you have a little bit of leeway. On the rest of it, I'm calling bullshit. This game is a thinking man's game and you did very little of that.

Aggression

" Is there some kind of problem here? Are you crazy or something? Let's discuss this outside... " Wang Chao

On september 27, 2013
rumata

This here is what makes this game great.
People with completely different mentality meeting in this untrusting place.
Sometimes you can reason with the crew and achieve things by cooperation, sometimes things completely fall apart, and there are times when individuals perceive things so different from you, and get/jump to weird conclusions that you just can't get wrap your mind around it.
I love that there are things that are perfectly clear from your point of view because of the extra info you have about yourself, but are absolutely confusing for another player!

And having debates after-ship are always interesting to read for me, so thanks for sharing! (all parties included)
On september 27, 2013
[6826491]

If you'll pardon the interjection from someone not from this ship: I agree with rumata. I've learned a great deal from reading the many afterparty threads, and treating them as if they were after action reports. Mistakes people made, events that just happened brilliantly, strategies to use for either side that are safely within the rules, etc. They've helped to make my gameplay better.

On that note, thank you.

Honestly, a ship is what you make of it. There's almost always gonna be a person or two that drive you up the wall and make you want to kill them (or yourself!)... but if you can band together with those that are making things pleasant and actually working for the good of the ship (or the mush, depending on your point of view), you can make even the most infuriating ship be at least not so bad

On september 28, 2013
[920355]
spacekadtHonestly, a ship is what you make of it. There's almost always gonna be a person or two that drive you up the wall and make you want to kill them (or yourself!)... but if you can band together with those that are making things pleasant and actually working for the good of the ship (or the mush, depending on your point of view), you can make even the most infuriating ship be at least not so bad

My advice for those disheartened by a mostly inactive ship:

If you must, do ALL the things! Just because its not your job to repair the PILGRED or advance Nexus research doesn't mean you can't pitch in. Sure you'll be spread a little thinner, but you can manage it! Maybe you won't make it to Eden, but you can always shoot for Sol or just see how much longer you can make it on a crew of 4!

Make the most of your adventure and try and enjoy yourself! The achievements you will talk about are the hardest earned.

On october 13, 2013
BerZerg

As Frieda, and after losing Alpha mush Hua, I evaded detection for five days and converted a new Mush, Finola. Paranoia was at its peak, with crew members killing off each other by droves. We were down by 8. I decided to use the upcoming expedition to kill off more of the crew members. I was the assigned pilot on the Icarus. With a grenade in hand and just before I piloted the Icarus, I detonated the grenade. People landed on the planet with no clue why their health was so low and I played along. My intention was to go down twice, in total, certainly killing them off.

Two problems.

First, Janice was with us and she was a Diplomat. No combat, and nearly no life loss from alien life forms.

Second, I got lost on the planet.

The crew found out what I did when they came back. They loaded up one fuel and got the hell out of there, leaving me muttering and cursing on a planet.

Win some, lose some. It was a great game, anyway.

BerZerg

As Frieda, and after losing Alpha mush Hua, I evaded detection for five days and converted a new Mush, Finola. Paranoia was at its peak, with crew members killing off each other by droves. We were down by 8. I decided to use the upcoming expedition to kill off more of the crew members. I was the assigned pilot on the Icarus. With a grenade in hand and just before I piloted the Icarus, I detonated the grenade. People landed on the planet with no clue why their health was so low and I played along. My intention was to go down twice, in total, certainly killing them off.

Two problems.

First, Janice was with us and she was a Diplomat. No combat, and nearly no life loss from alien life forms.

Second, I got lost on the planet.

The crew found out what I did when they came back. They loaded up one fuel and got the hell out of there, leaving me muttering and cursing on a planet.

Win some, lose some. It was a great game, anyway.

[1403405]

what a nice thread, here is my big fail, we almost lost the game because of me:

we were two mush (Raluca and me, jin-su) ready to take the humans back to Sol and claim the planet. The plan was to kill Chun using knife and blaster and then move to Sol. To do that I was full AP and I planned to activated my Shooter skill that I had hiden from the human. So I killed Chun, using knife and then blaster but since I stupidly forgot to activate shooter I used 4 AP instead of 4 free shots. When I arrive at the bridge, I realized I was 1 AP too short..... I got killed by humans but they went back to Sol without knowing Raluca was mush so it is a victory, but that was close!
On october 13, 2013
rumata

Why do you consider that a victory?
I see all 3 Mush at the last 4 places in Glory ranking.
On october 13, 2013
[1403405]

Because a successful infiltration with return to Sol is considered a mush victory. You had no idea we were three...

If you are not convinced, go the end game page, scrool to Raluca and click on the little icon that list all the details of the glory, you will see:

1 x Contaminated Invasion of Sol ( + 16 )


It was much debate about this on the french server and the commonly accepted is:

if humans go back to Sol without mush with the serum they win, without the serum they loose

if humans go back to sol with mush and they know about it, it is a tie, serum or not

if humans go back to sol not knowing a mush is on board it is mush victory, serum or not

if a mush start the journey to Sol it is a mush victory, serum or not.


Regarding glory, the system is so unbalanced that nobody use it for deciding which team wins. it is more a personal victory stuff.
On october 13, 2013

On october 14, 2013
[1887923]

In my last ship Stephen was acting suspicious and causing grief in the refectory so I was told to go kill him. I went to go beat him up and hit him numerous times until I had two AP left. Hitting Stephen over and over had made me dirty, so I figured I had the perfect excuse to make a spore. (I was Mush.) I did so and conveniently forgot Stephen was only half-dead and would still report what I just did in the logs. I knew that the moment someone entered the kitchen I'd be busted so I took Doorman and sabotaged the door. I also took Hard-Boiled.

I sat there waiting to die and my Mush teammate Raluca reported the broken door, not out of spite, but because it would have looked suspicious if she didn't since she went by it so many times. I expected someone to enter the room, but no one did for several hours. Then Chun came along and fixed the door- but didn't go inside.

I guess when someone finally came in to finish Stephen off they found me. I didn't get to watch what happened because I had to go to bed. It was a shame because I was hoping to mutate under the protection of the broken door and then raise some real drama but I simply was assassinated. Stephen was too, heh.

What I learned- I make a terrible Mush.
On october 14, 2013
BerZerg

On october 15, 2013
Enfilade

Yeah, lack of oxygen has been one of the biggest threats in most of my voyages so far, often because only one person has been scanning/inactive captain. Any suggestions for how to help people avoid this fail? Clearly, more people need to scan, but who?
On october 15, 2013
Absydian
EnfiladeYeah, lack of oxygen has been one of the biggest threats in most of my voyages so far, often because only one person has been scanning/inactive captain. Any suggestions for how to help people avoid this fail? Clearly, more people need to scan, but who?

If it is becoming clear that you need to find an oxygen planet fast, the first thing to do is have Janice (or whoever is NERON admin) set NERON's priorities to Astronavigation. Then everyone with astrophysicist (Kuan Ti & Frieda) or the IT skill (Eleesha & Janice) should scan for planets, as they get 'free' scans on the planet's zones (they still have to spend 3AP finding a planet, but then each scan to uncover the zones will use 1 IT point.) Also, people with no jobs in particular (such as Stephen, since he only cooks once every 4 days, and Gioele) should help out if oxygen is a huge concern.

The second thing to do is to make sure people aren't wasting time scanning useless planets; make sure everyone scanning knows to dump planets with the Mankrog or volcano sectors, as these have a high chance of a crew fatality. Hope that helps

On october 15, 2013
Absydian

Our fail:

As we come to the end of our NERON upgrades we are left with 2 options; NERON participation or additional NERON terminals...

*sigh...*
On october 15, 2013
spacekadt

The current ship I'm on has been the best I've ever played. Frieda has done the VAST majority of the scanning with occasional help from Gioele and his coffee. Other than that, I don't think anyone has scanned any planets at all. We're on day 9 with plenty of oxygen.

But we also have Ian who's actually doing his job and we're now producing more o2 from plants than we consume in a day (assuming the o2 tanks don't break on us).

You really don't need more than one or two people scanning planets, you just need reliable people doing it. Eat to scan if you have to. But since no one shares results with anyone else (through the panel, anyway), it's a terrible waste of AP to have multiple people scanning. The only time I'd make an exception to that is when you're absolutely desperate for something and just don't seem to be able to find it with just the primary scanner(s) doing it.
On october 15, 2013
Enfilade

Thanks for the thoughts, Absydian and spacekadt. I think you're right; what's happening is a chain of misfortune: start with an unreliable primary scanner who, when active, doesn't find many oxy planets, and then add an inactive or mush captain. So much fail...
On october 15, 2013
Absydian

Having an active Ian makes a huge difference to long term oxygen supplies. But every ship needs to find oxygen at least once in, like the first 5/6 days. Things can get pretty frantic when scans keep coming up with nothing. My last ship we found a planet with O2 but when we went exploring the pump failed and things looked pretty bad. Everyone want back to the planet scanner and started finding a second planet. Eventually I found one, but with 4O2 left and 15 sectors to explore, I didn't have enough AP to uncover them all and when we landed we got O2 in one sector and then in the next the entire Icarus crew got blew up by a volcano. Sometimes, there's nothing you can do.

NERON projects also make a HUGE difference to planet scanning. The ship I'm in has the one that reduces the AP cost by one and the upgrade that uncovers an extra sector. We're in day 12 now and still have a plentyful 20 units left, even though we had 2 fires this morning and both broken oxygen tanks (one of which is still broken).

Co-ordination is key, but there are a lot of other factors that can help.

[2767757]

Not really a fail, but I've been noticing a rise of inactive players. It's really unfortunate when you see so many people being so active and trying to help.
On october 17, 2013
spacekadt
PringlesXDNot really a fail, but I've been noticing a rise of inactive players. It's really unfortunate when you see so many people being so active and trying to help.

I think what you see is new beta players (they just released a key yesterday on fb) that logged in and either forgot because it's not part of their routine yet or decided they didn't like the game (with or without giving it a chance) so just never bothered to log back in.

It happens every time there's an influx of new players into a new game. It's gonna keep going in waves like this until it's in public release. Then we'll see a HUGE wave of it and I think it'll mostly die down after that. There will always be the occasional inactive folks, but not the large numbers like we've seen with ships full of new people.

At least that's what I'm choosing to believe so we have more hope for the game down the road

On november 16, 2013
[6826491]

Hide the items, while moving through as many rooms as you can before they kill you. It will make their search a bit more difficult. If they're slow to catch up to you, hide the items one on top of the other. Most people won't think to search a room twice.

On november 16, 2013
Rain
WyrmieDude... do you have any idea how hard it is to spore convert person by yourself?

Yes. Had exact same thing happen to me, only partner was inactive for a few days before randomly coming alive to mutate. Solo mush strategy depends on the ship. If it's slow to get cameras up and/or people are hanging in unprotected areas, do try to convert. However, if things get in shape quickly and sporing people becomes difficult, I'd advise not to make any spores unless you're already dirty from legit human activity and keep them for phagocyte, which doesn't show up on any logs, and which heals the damage you'll take from showering. Be more human than human, as helpful as you can, and watch humans kill one another until you see a good moment to do maximum damage.

On november 17, 2013
ShuDog

Now that I am last on my ship, it's time to relate the tale of Paola's love and despair. It is hilarious.
So after the trauma of having unresponsive father suddenly save her life with a new mission, only to have him die of depression within moments – Paola retreated to the dorm to regroup. She was exhausted from trying to kill a Mush, as was the rest of the crew.

AP, we were desperate for it.

Except sharing the dorm was Roland, our wisecracking and only pilot. He'd been fighting Hunters the whole time, and his morale was dangerously low.

So while Paola's sleeping (that's not creepy uh huh), Roland suggests a little... interlude. Of doing things. She had the same thought; it's not like she has MP, and hey it's a dorm.

Then she finds that there can be no doing of things while there's a camera in the dorm.

Distraught, Roland flees the dorm! Leaving Paola with little AP and a rather pressing need to conserve it since she has to come *back* to the Bridge somehow... But Roland is the only pilot, and if she gets back to the Bridge in time for Hunters to blow it up , none of it will matter. Then she has an idea.

She rushes out to the bay! (-1MP) So excited that her sacrifice of AP will help the ship and what's so wrong about morale boosting ....! Only to find that Roland has taken off on patrol before she could get to the walkie talkie.

Apparently he is hellbent on going out in a blaze of glory, killing off Hunters. It's the last moments of his life, he's going to live it up! Also he says Jasmine is his only love now Yeah, whatever the patrol ship's name is.

Except THERE IS NO CAMERA IN THE BAY.

Paola stalks back into the dorm. (-1MP)However she wants morale too, so she dismantles the camera (minus AP), and accosts Roland as soon as he slinks back (minus AP). There may have been sleeping involved too (plus AP).

The next day, she finds out she cannot drop the camera, it has to be installed. So BACK TO THE DORM... (-1MP) Minus even more AP...

And that's how I went to the dorm in a desperate attempt to recharge AP, and managed to lose all my AP and all my MP and waste about 2 cycles. Among other things.

At least Roland was charming about it all.

So now that I've gone out in my blaze of glory, I can share my fail.

I was an alpha mush and the other alpha seemed fairly new to the game. Spored in front of a camera as he converted Raluca who was totally inactive. The crew figured it out rather quickly and killed the alpha and let Raluca live til she was steel plated.

Anyway, the point is that I was a lone mush for a while. Based on french wiki, it looked like I could put three spores on the same ration and whoever ate it would get all three spores. It was worth a shot so I spiked the ration three times and figured what the hell, I'll eat while I'm here to throw people off... only I forgot to change my selection and ate the ration I had just triple-spored.

Still kicking my own ass about that one.

Ouch.
I put 2 spores in a ration once, the person who ate it later that same day only got 1 spore. I think what the french wiki was saying regarding that is that, basically, it varies in effect, but if you have more than one spore on you, all will go into the ration. Would like some confirmation that multiple sporing from one ration is indeed possible though.
On december 6, 2013
spacekadt
Rainbut if you have more than one spore on you, all will go into the ration.

This I can verify as not so. I had two spores on me when I spored the ration the first time and it only took one spore. If that used to happen in French Mush (or still does), it at least doesn't happen here

On december 6, 2013
[1384452]
RainWould like some confirmation that multiple sporing from one ration is indeed possible though.

Confirming that it does work. My mush partner did it on my previous ship. Maybe it only works with 3 spores?
On december 6, 2013
NERON

MrMuzConfirming that it does work. My mush partner did it on my previous ship. Maybe it only works with 3 spores?Works with two. I tried it on coffee. Maybe it's just buggy. It feels a bit like a bit of an exploit, to be honest.

On topic:
"Ok so we're starting to run low on O2 here. I got this planet here that looks like a good candidate. Shall we go?"
"We should finish up with out rebel signal and scrap first."
hunters show up
"So pilots, how goes hunter hunting?"
"I got smashed arms. Actions cost 3 more AP. I need surgery before I can go."
"I killed some hunters. How is our mush hunt going by the way?"
"Our last mush is idle. Zzz's and it would have died from morale loss otherwise."
"Speaking of morale, let's keep it around. It's not doing any harm and we can't afford any more morale."
Some time later
"Ok I killed the last hunters, let's get the scrap and go!"
"My arms are still smashed. Lying down costs me AP"
hunters show up
"Out of AP shooting now"
"Why is our second pilot still not patched up?"
Some time later
"I killed them now to get the scrap..."
hunters show up
"You know what? Let's just move. We need that O2"
"I got the fuel!"
"What? But I already got it..."
"..."
"We put too much in, we need a new planet now."
"Why is all our stuff broken? I'm going to check it out."
"Oh hey, our mush doesn't have the Zzz anymor-"

On december 11, 2013
NERON

The public channel of my latest ship is 60% roleplay. It perpetually has three pages RP nonsense at the top and you need to scroll down a bunch to find any relevant news on the ship. I regularly post summaries of the previous few cycles because I'm afraid people don't want to dig through the irrelevant stuff and miss things. Not that anything lasts very long on the first page. Threads on planet coordinates, death reports, incoming asteroids and other emergencies get lost because they get buried under joke threads within a few cycles.

We often mistake actual information and assistance requests for roleplay. Which causes people dismiss it as important and to reply with even more roleplay, further burying it within text mountain. The only living threads that are remotely serious are the item and dirt reports.

Once, I did a head count from the comrades bar, realizing something didn't quite add up, I spent a few minutes going over the characters trying to recall who I left out from the death count. Only after I scrolled waaaayyyyy down and read each post properly did I find NERON announcing a death that I didn't even know about. Because the first time, I only read the crew replies and I thought they were all just joking about one of NERON's randomly generated announcements.

It's utterly dysfunctional- and totally awesome!

On december 11, 2013
NERON

There was even one point where I feared an innocent player was in danger of being attacked because of a runaway RP thread.
On december 12, 2013
1412

Here's the story of how I learned to never pick the Traitor skill!
I was a mush in a very organized ship. The other mush dies early on, not sporing anybody and only talking once: asking me what to do while he was being killed. Anyway, I managed to spore someone twice... only for them to kill themselves before the third spore. At this point, I figured that my best bet was to go on an expedition with the traitor skill, maybe slightly increase the odds of Very Bad Things... and every single result goes wrong. In addition, I had the lowest health from showering after sporing up and never healing, so it was fairly obvious whop was the mush. And to make things worse, I led the expedition and didn't have enough AP to do anything to defend myself.

On december 12, 2013
[7922882]

Constiaspore serum can be made without rations. You can use a pill or spyce left in the lab to initiate the research instead, which is better since the medlab is closer and 1 spyce isn't as valuable as a ration.

On december 18, 2013
[7970474]

Our ship isn't dead yet, but we were doing great. We dealt with two griefers and managed to kill both Mush by the end of Day 2, and we had a really active crew. By day 8, we had almost all Neron Projects researched, 8 mature plants, a decent amount of oxygen, fuel, 99% ship hull and maxed shields, and 10 crew members, most of which were active.

Then we went on an expedition, picking the best planet out of all bad choices, and Finola, our Diplomat, got lost. With a lot of dangerous life in the zone, we feared the whole team would be destroyed without Finola, and decided to move the ship and rely on Magnetic Return to retrieve our expedition team. Little did we know how worthless Magnetic Return actually was....

About two-three minutes before we took off, Finola was found, but in the confusion of it all, we continued and took off anyways! And were greeted by 4 death notices from Neron....

We're all really sorry guys, I hope we can play together again. It was embarrassing, losing you all like that. Needless to say...I won't be touching Magnetic Return ever again.
On december 18, 2013
[2401411]

Aww how sad. I never knew magnetic return was useless, thanks for reminding me

On december 18, 2013
Mystaira

The problem with expeditions and magnetic return is that... the expedition team is on the planet and not in the Icarus. So the Icarus will return to the ship, but anybody not in the Icarus (due to being on the expedition or because they have a spacesuit on a non-oxygen planet) won't return with it.

The net is best for preventing Oops, we left Hua behind because she was out in a patrol ship/pasiphae...
On december 18, 2013
NERON

Magnetic Net and Magnetic Return are two separate projects. Net saves patrol ships, Return saves the Icarus... which added to the expedition crew not being saved makes it next to useless.
On december 18, 2013
[7742291]

It's a "recover from total failure".

If a MUSH steals the Icarus to suicide on a planet, the Icarus is gone forever, and you can only use patrol ships, unless...you've researched Magnetic Return. Then, you'd get the Icarus back. So, not useless, but not top tier.
On december 18, 2013
Annette

The "sabotage" and "Access terminal" buttons are situated very closely together.

Day 3 cycle 5 I was invited to a private channel of 6 to talk about the events of Ian's attack. Apparently raulca who was in the medlab at the time of attack didn't attack Ian even through she was online with suspected full ap. So I investigated both rooms of the fight. Then followed raulca. As I was heading into the Icarus bay where raluca was a new mush appeared??? So I then a calculated and visited all areas of at least 2 people in it. Luckily for me there were two areas the bravo dorm and the bridge. To my surprise there was a camera on the bravo dorm. But not on the bridge with like 5 people in there. 3 of them were the inactives and Terrence helped kill Ian. So I wrote on the general chat channel " due to recent mush-related Terrence,Frieda,finola, myself,raluca and hua are under extreme surveillance and as of now kill hua. Turned out everybody was like why would we kill hua? But raluca was like you're no angel eleesha and also why am I a suspect? I was like no one out of the 14 people remaining on the ship said I was a angel. Oh perfect timing why did you pick up the plastmite armor at the Icarus bay this cycle. To my surprise she said "you picked it up". I replied " umm no you did" I went back and copied pasted the whole log for the cycle in the Icarus bay. Then I went to the bravo dorm to sleep since I only had 2 mp left. Then she said "I had enough of this" and she put a link on the post I (cautiously) copied the link onto a new tab and saw something that would haunt me at the time. It was a cutout of a photo that said eleesha picked up the armor in the way you would normally see it in the logs. So I decided to see 1 more time of the logs at the Icarus bay. I was telling the truth but I forgot one thing as I was leaving the bay.... I couldn't leave I ran out of both ap and mp. (Fail 1) F..k me now I am either dead or I will be a mush because there was no camera there. Sitting there for 10 minutes ( not listening to any music this time around) I came up with a last resort plan I wrote " KILL ME GO RIGHT AHEAD I AM AT THE ICARUS BAY BUT BEFORE THE ATTACK CHECK THE LOGS IF I AM NOT TELLING THE TRUTH KILL ME IF I AM TELLING THE TRUTH KILL RALUCA."

Day 3 cycle 7 Jin su comfirms my statement. I was telling the truth (mush fail)

Day 4 cycle 8 we kill raluca and ended hua as well as we caught his destroying the oxygen tanks.

Day 5 cycle 6 due to everybody killing mushes we didn't have ap to deal with our oxygen crisis and over the cycle leading to cycle 6 people started dying and i was officially last person standing when I died.

Even through it was short lived I learned a lot in this ship I had a lot of fun and the fail were

My luck losing count of my mp
Fail attempt for raluca to frame me

On january 2, 2014
[6826491]

It's a fail for the rest of the crew, because the dismantler gets you, at best, 50 hull points back. The shield can protect against triple that in damage or more on long voyages. Even if it was with the best of intentions, it's also going to require that much more AP spent on repairs later. That AP could have been used to further the ship in other ways, not to mention the scrap saved for building BPs. The game is challenging enough, even with the shield online.
On january 2, 2014
psibertus

it's a hindrance for the rest of the crew but if they had no involvement in the other research being completed then they didn't fail in any way. at least by the definition that I understand it.

it would certainly be a fail to pick Dismantler ahead of Plasma Shield though I agree

beat43210

ok here it is i am playing as eleesha in this ship so day 3 comes around and we have 1 mush dead and we got 31 oxygen and things are looking good. i didnt pick any of my skills (tracker, observant or dertermined) because i was sitting on the fence on which one to pick one mush is dead so tracker has a 50:50 of being useful, observant with only 1 mush and free searching the ship or determined with mush around.

So i sat in the bravo dorm thinking and i check general chat and roland said to kill ian as he was a mush. so i follow ians tracks without tracker skill and i find him at medlab with terrence and i attack ian 4 times i left the game.

50 minutes later i remembered that i didnt leave the room so i loged back in to find roland telling people to kill me as there was a body swap and he thinks its me. i have been in body swap situations before (as a human) so i know 3 things about body swap.

A the victim must have one spore
B it is an irreversible action
C it is an undetectable action under usual conditions (a skill or the victim telling is excluded)

so the first thing i say to myself is this *FIND THE HOLES* as i have watched a lot of judge judy i know that they need decisive proof in order to kill me so i wrote a super super long text the size of about 500 words why i am not the mush. to simpify everything and not write 500 words here the reasons were:
1. proof???? where is it.
2. i have been inactive so if i were involved in the swap it would be revealed in the tabs (inactive swap is revealed
3. i have been sitting in the dorms 100% alone in the hallways on on the dorms in front of a camera and because of that i knew i had no spores
4. it is an undetectable action so how would roland know if there has been a swap in the first place

i wrote all of this down in super high detail and went to the bravo dorms and went to sleep.

turns out Frieda was all like she is 100% mush and played staby staby with a knife on my body without tellling anybody saying i am gonna kill her and i died. so i died and i check chat now here is the funny part of this roland says "oh she was a noob by never picking a skill" and now he is accusing freida for the swap clap, clap, clap good job roland your are an idiot. framing me without proof is just like walking to a battle field in the open with a gun with no bullets.

morale of the story " *COVER YOUR BASES* " because if you don't you are gonna have problems in both mush and in real life.

the fail here was A roland accusing me with 4 holes in his claim
B the crew failing to contain the situation causality-free

thats all for this fail hope you guys got something out of it see you all around

On january 5, 2014
npfan

To be fair, did you ever tell anyone you were undecided about which skill to pick? If not, it's reasonable to think someone switched bodies with you since skills reset, so that's some evidence. You said you were inactive, but if only 50 minutes have passed since you last logged in and you been attacking Ian, then inactive swap would not be revealed because you were never 'Inactive' in the first place. If there was not a camera in Medlab, it's possible Ian spored you in those 50 minutes, so that's an invalid defence.

Don't get me wrong. I'm not saying you deserved to get killed, and I understand how it feels to be indecisive about which skills to take. When I played bronze Jin Su, I had a hard time deciding whether to pick Leader or Pilot since it depends on whether there's more of a morale problem or a hunter problem.

On february 8, 2014
npfan

Moral of the story: Never take a bed unless there's enough beds for all the active Pilots.

Just so you are aware, it is possible to be sanctioned for using a weapon to kick someone off the bed since you only need to use your fist to do that and it could be seen as trying to use excess force against someone not suspected to be Mush. It's similar to punching someone multiple times only because you want a bed. I'm not saying this Chao will be sanctioned, but it's something you should know.

Also blasters have a lower chance of hitting someone than a punch so you have slightly higher odds at getting them off the bed without injuring them. A full gold lvl 3+ Chao does more damage with his fists than his blaster anyway. Except those rare headshot moments, but there's only like a 2% chance for that.

And as Security Chief, it's Chao's job to make sure that the beds are clear for the pilots, astrophysicsts, or whatever important roles.

On february 9, 2014
[7937939]

Ok, I have a load of fails, all from one ship, so here we go!
http://mush.twinoid.com/theEnd/2140
So I had just started a new ship, and was about to play one of my favourite characters - Hua. I instantly picked all my usual skills - Pilot, Botanist , Survivalist and Technician . I did my bit here and there around the ship before everyone was awake. Whenever I play ships, they usually finish filling around cycle 4, 5 or 6, when I sleep. So I wake up the next morning, and get a friendly message:
Welcome to Mush!
I was instantly shocked, and having only just woken up, I proceeded to fall off my bed.
This was my first time playing as mush, and it was about my 7th or 8th ship.
I knew I was going to have a lot of trouble, as my partner was.. Finola. She almost single handedly had already completed most of the mush research. This makes life tough. Not only that, but she was also a gold mush, and had ALREADY taken some skills. Traitor, Trapper, and.. Annonymush... I was almost instantly face-palming myself as she raves in the mush chat saying it was an accident.. Now when I usually play as a human, I'm a really nice player and do EVERYTHING I can to help. Well, I guess that's where most of my AP was going to go. Since I had botanist AND tech, I knew I was going to be stretched thin AP wise. But I also had an excuse to be running around, being dirty. It wasn't till day 3 that I decided to pick our first target. Kuan Ti. He had been inactive since the start, so I thought, 'Hey, lets convert him!' He was idling in RC just waiting to become part of our mushyness! Well, as I was inserting a spore into him, and Paola walks right in the room.. I instantly start panicking thinking she saw me and I was SCREAMING in mush chat thinking I was found out. Well, I decided to look at the wiki and found out I was safe. PHEW! We finially converted Kuan Ti, and I took annonymush. Now we had an expo to plan for. I thought, 'Hey, this Traitor skill looks nice, I might try it!' So the expo went ahead, and the expo crew were: Me (Hua), Terrence, Frieda and Paola. So I went ahead and launched the expo, and every single zone was some assortment of bad. I was almost crying. I took the brunt of the damage too. Everyone on that expo got +1 spore too, due to a crystalline zone. After posting the expo stats, the crew were shocked, and instantly knew that there was definitely a mush aboard that expo. I needed to do something, I was freaking out, so I opened a chat with Chao, and starting talking, convincing him that Paola was mush, because during the expo, she got lost, we had 3 partially fine zones, then picked her back up and it went to bad zones. He told me he was actually suspecting Frieda because she hadn't been scanning planets much. He invited Paola to the chat, and she 'claimed' to have eaten a banana then a ration, so she was in the clear. The convo went on, and they deduced that it was either Terrence or myself that were mush. And Paola said: 'I really hope you're not mush, because you're really nice and helpful.' So I made the crucial mistake of making my next mushy target Terrence. It was dark and musty, and I was sporing in Alpha Bay 2. This was the perfect time to target Terrence, saying I didn't have enough AP to build an object. So I took Trapper, trapped the storage and held onto the bp that I wanted Terrence to build. I then waited for him to come online. He finially came along, and I spiked him, then claimed 'I forgot to drop the blueprint' when he complained it wasn't there. He also said: "Why are you hiding in here all suspicious like? Are you going to spore me? Then he used the shelf, and BAM! Another mush! Which was kinda pointless if you ask me, seeing as though people were thinking either Terrence or I were mush. By now it was day 5, somehow our mushyness was still alive, I hopped into a patrol ship and started shooting hunters. I saw this action that I had never used before.. 'Sabotage, 2 AP' I thought, 'hey, I might try this out!' So I sabotaged my patrol ship, and I couldn't land. A few cycles later I had taken damage from repairing stuff, steel plates and washing myself, so I ran along to the lab where Chun was, and asked for heals. I only had 5 . A few minutes later [irl] my brother came in and said to my Mum "He's playing a game where you are evil, and you have to sabotage your team" and I had to hop off. I came back 2 hours later, to find myself, Terrence, aand Kuan Ti dead. Chao used his traitor skill on Terrence, Chun used Premonition skill on me and they thought they were mush free. Thought. Not sure what happened after our mushy fall, but Finola's final words were: "A good mush is a patient mush." Hope you enjoyed reading!

Terrence : ...... It's boring.... nothing to do.... nothing I can do.....I'm gonna die of boredom! What planets did we find, any good among them?
NERON : I set a few more fires. Just for you. No more dull moments! [Hax!] In a few cycles I will have the SDF hunter beacon up an running. Isn't this exciting? [Hax!]

NERON [Automated Message] : Alert, detection of hostile vessels within range of the Daedalus! Information bulletin: « did you get that? Enemies. You know? Bad guys? … Well don't just stand there! »

NERON : [Hax!] My hunter beacon worked !! [Hax!] [Hax!] Having fun now Terrence? [Hax!]
On february 26, 2014
[6826491]

There's a fun mechanic built into the game...the longer it is you go between "big" waves of ships, the larger the wave will be when it inevitably does arrive. I don't know the exact formula for it, but if you're getting "average" waves once or twice a day, then you probably won't see any large ones for a while. If only small waves are arriving, or no waves for a day or two, expect the next wave to be huge in comparison.
On february 26, 2014
Darkfirephoenix

I could imagine how fun it would be if you are on a ship at day 10 and never got Hunters and then comes a wave with +60Hunters!

On february 26, 2014
[6826491]

I once saw a Day 4 wave of 19 hunters arriving at once, We had maybe a single wave of 2-4 hunters after the initial wave on Day 1, so imagine our shock when we saw them arrive...

[6826491]

The Microwave uses no AP to cook. If she was Mush, it's a valid move. If she was a griefer...I hope that you quickly and violently removed her from the ship, and reported her for that asshattery. Such behavior is considered serious griefing.

Sometimes you get lucky, and the Sol connection isn't cut. If you use the Microwave while the Sol link is offline, then there is no problem.

On march 14, 2014
[6826491]

It has unlimited charges. Why does it have unlimited charges? How reliable would a battery operated microwave be?

Just warn everyone that anyone who uses the microwave before Comms are completed will be treated as Mush and executed. I usually have it moved to the Bridge on most of my ships, and that usually serves as a sufficient deterrent to use it. After Comms are done, it's moved to the Rear Corridor, along with some of the rations from our expos.

On march 22, 2014
[7937939]

30 minutes ago, which was last cycle, I came online and we had 3 hull, and 7 hunters. I freaked out, grabbed the coffee and ran to the bridge. I quickly hacked the command console and it got me in on the first go. I was all like 'Yay look at that skill!' And I aimed us towards a planet and got ready to jet off.. 'Advance.'
Janice sets the ship in motion. Their exalted ego is visible and their fury makes the surrounding air shudder. But...But... The engines are turning but nothing is happening... An Arack is stopping takeoff with its gravitational field!
What.. WHAT!?! AN ARACK?!?! Cries.
So I'm screaming at the crew to take it out, and the only person online is our comms person Eleesha, she is out of AP and completely full. Nobody else hears my wails, so Eleesha and I pretend hug because I don't want to leave the command console.. The minutes ticked down and I accepted that our death was coming.. I decided that myself (Janice) and Neron should have one last monologue together saying how nice the ship was.. They say they love each other and neron says 'Kaboom'
Only, the cycle clops over, and the ship doesn't blow up.. We still have 3 hull, but our oxygen is lower...
So.. It seems, the RNG gods love us.. Either that, or something glitched up..

beat43210

i got an idea. how about we use this thread to put the fails up for voting for the best fail of season 1

i promoted this idea before but it was like half way through the season.

if any anybody can make a thread followed by a link to this thread that will be great.

it goes as follows:

1. all fails from this thread are able to win
2. all fails that are created up until the end of season 1 are able to win
3. i will personally come to the fail thread and make a post saying theses are all the fails of season 1
4. when season 2 starts on the seperate thread people can make their vote
5. to make a vote please go to fail thread and copy and paste the original post of the fail and write the user who wrote the post
6. you may vote for 5 different fails per user (so we dont create too much havoc)
7. voting will go for exactly 4 weeks after the launch of season 2
8. once 4 weeks have passed voting will close.
9. myself and possibly others can count the votes
10. we will announce the top 5 fails of season 1 and i will personally write a post about exactly which 5 fails people have choosen and announce the winner.
11. winners (best fails) will win bragging rights that they suffered the best fail of season 1
12. if we are lucky we can give out better prizes
13. if we are popular we can create a season 2 fail thread followed by best fails of season 2.

Nice to know the mission went better than I thought it did. No-one said anything in the public channels so we had no real idea how successful the attack was or that Raluca was dying. Sorry for ruining your plasma shields / o2 ducts on day 1 ship.

If it makes you feel any better, I originally planned to assemble the grenades on D2C1 or D2C2 (when I'd have had the mp to assemble one without converting mp to ap) but Stephen jumped the gun and assembled the grenades about 5 minutes into D1C7 which kinda forced the issue.

That was my fault. I told him we should assemble the grenades but didn't think to suggest a time to do it, so he assumed I wanted him to make both immediately.

He hadn't assembled two grenades before and didn't realise how much mp/ap it uses. As a result he was unable to really assist the attack. If we'd done the attack D2C2 we'd have also had the knife and duct tape on us when we went in along with an extra 4ap each from phagocyte.

We'd also put spores into roland and kuan ti, so with an extra couple of cycles ap we could have killed everyone in a-dorm then transferred to two fresh characters which would have given us enough ap to kill chun.

So, plenty of mush fail on that ship too. But it sounds like we did just enough damage.

So I leave (by the way, I forgot to say he dropped his lizaro after attacking me in medlab and legged it to the bridge where multiteamster Janice is) right before cycle change and I kick him out of the sofa, then I take the sofa. On april 15, 2014
Azzyquemint

ElZappoTerrible fail concerning me

Crewmate leaves the dorm and reenters dirty. I check the logs and the person was away for not even a minute. Said crewmate is clean all of a sudden and got hurt by showering (at least i thought so. I saw some red blinking). I open up a channel, but get no answer..and sentence her to death.

Turned out to be a human. Most likely a newbie that had a shower accident after doing some random stuff to get dirty..in under 1 minute.

Lesson learned..it might look like an elephant, smell like an elephant, sound like an elephant, but it's just a squirrel that looks and behaves weird.

Get used to explaining to the ship the basic rules at the start of the game, such as dirtiness, and what is generally expected of everybody as a whole. I know that when I make the dirty threads on my ships, I lay down what it means to be dirty, why it's suspicious, and then encourage people to report being dirty, how they got dirty, and to go wash immediately.

Cover your bases as early as possible so that you are justified acting on them later.

So, I thought he figured he'd take Traitor after his opportunity to move the ship during the expo. I go into Icarus Bay and notice him shredding something.

Well, being Chao, I figure, time to take him out. So, I shoot him three times and then torture him. I see that he has a couple of 'Consume's back to back. HA! He ate spores! Time to finish him.

Human.

It gets worse. You see, that "food test" man thing he said to me, well, I thought he was just insulting me. Actually, he had eaten a banana in the Lab, then ate a ration in the Rear Corridor for AP to launch the expo. Also, he may have gotten sick on the expo.

Yes, I accidentally killed a human that was sick and had done a food test.
(This also doubles as a fail for him. When the crew forces you to move the ship and go on an expo, and you do a food test. TELL SOMEONE! Also, you know, move the ship and go on the expo.)

On april 21, 2014
[6826491]

This could technically be an AP thread on its own, but with the various fails, I think it belongs here instead. The ship just ended.

First one: Just a few cycles in, and Jin Su threatens to kill me (Janice) for using a bed. He also encouraged the crew to violate the Neutral Play rule, and he threatened to kill anyone who disagreed with him. He took Pilot and Cold Blooded, and I was a level four Gold Janice. I not only recognized his particular style of aggressive "roleplay" from previous reports filed against him, but he was willing to encourage the crew to break rules, and to break them himself by killing people without just cause - starting with me. I even revealed myself as a Mod just to drive the point home that the rules do not support his behavior. He decided to claim that "nobody has ever been sanctioned for Anti-Mush research before Mush selection." Which is a statement not remotely grounded in reality, because I've handed out sanctions to people for doing exactly that.

Never mind the fact that he purposely chose Cold Blooded instead of Leader, indicating that he had no serious intentions of maintaining morale (if he did, why would he be so willing to kill me over using a bed?). So...I killed him just minutes after the ship filled, before he could kill me or anyone else. I knew he was probably human, but he intended to grief the ship as part of what he considered "roleplay". I eliminated him as a threat to the rest of the ship.

Second: Finola never finished the tutorial, and a few other newbies didn't, either. Hell, half the crew was inactive from the very beginning, and it only got worse from there. Chun spent most of the voyage idle in RBS, so research was next to nonexistent. More about Chun's fail later. Ian tried to research, but nobody was around or had the AP to relay for him. Not one bit of research was completed in our four day voyage.

The Mush: The first two I killed probably had no idea that we suspected them, but Hua, Frieda, and Chun were in a PM with me, as we tried to figure out who the Mush were. Granted, Chun was idle the whole time. I don't think the Mush failed, per se. But here's how they got caught.

Stephen was supposed to move the Superfreezer, and didn't do it. He didn't say he needed more time, but if you say you're going to do something, and then don't do it...it is obviously suspicious. I killed him for that, and for being dirty without announcing why. One down.

Paola finished one project from the Bridge, then came to Bravo Dorm to just stand around for a few cycles. She didn't have a Sofa yet; Medlab was empty and she never used it, so I figured she'd gone there to secretly shower. My suspicions were confirmed when she took a bed for a while, then got up, came back, and showered, because she was "working on Pilgred." By this point, the bridge Sofa had been built. True, she did work on Pilgred, but nobody asked her to help with it, and Comms needed to be worked on. Granted, she was also there to turn Raluca. I killed Paola for not doing her job, and noticed that we still had one Mush showing, which meant Paola took Anonymush before I killed her.

Raluca was an easy target for conversion. She didn't stay in a turret, and that's how Paola got her. The fact that Raluca ended up spending a few cycles in RBS with Chun was just a dead giveaway. Extracting a spore in RBS with Chun standing there was a smoking gun. I killed her after that.

At this point, Pilgred's at 45%. Terrence was Tech, but idle on Day 1, so Hua switched from piloting to Pilgred. I try to rally anyone still alive and active to help relay, and...only Frieda and I show up. Gioele is now in command, since Chao earned himself a quarantine, but Gioele is barely active, due to the holiday. We finally finish Pilgred on D4C2, after Hua, Frieda and I all ate for a final rush, and...Gioele isn't online. We have four hunters outside and prepared to strike, and just 6 hull left.

It turns out Chun has the Hacker Kit, and now we have to kill her to get it. With my last two AP, I MISS the first 90% attack, but manage to hit her once with the knife, and Hua finishes her off. Great, now we can go home, right? NOPE! Hua gets the Hacker Kit to the bridge, and asks for anyone who has the AP to hack it, with under 20 minutes before the end of the cycle...and Frieda and I were both tapped out. Nobody else was online to help us. BOOM!

We fought SO hard to survive, though. If we could have bought ourselves just one more cycle, we could have made it. That was one of my shorter voyages, but it was also one of the more memorable ones. I ended up doing almost all the killing, and each one was justified by the circumstances.

[8216957]

I've noticed that Jin Su's are usually played by meatheads with poor writing skills who take their status as a "commander" too seriously... I'm picking Jin Su every chance I get from now on just so that other people can't do it and mess it up

On april 21, 2014
[6826491]
LastlawyerI've noticed that Jin Su's are usually played by meatheads with poor writing skills who take their status as a "commander" too seriously... I'm picking Jin Su every chance I get from now on just so that other people can't do it and mess it up

That strategy has (in a sense) backfired on me, more than once. I would see a player who would play their character badly, and then I'd try to be that character on my next ship. Then another character on that ship would end up being played badly, and I'd end up trying to cover that role in the next game...and so on. Eventually, I decided I'd stick to a half dozen or so characters most of the time, and start leveling the others once the first group is maxed out. That way, I always have high level options, and I can cover a few roles if I have to.

As I proved on my last ship, there is an answer for any murderous, tyrannical, and illogical Jin Su players: Kill and report. At least I can use a character I play well in the process.

* Magically appears and vanishes soon after. They say it's a-once-in-a-lifetime-chance for such a delight. If you see it, take the chance!

* 16 Morale

* 16 Satisfaction

On may 6, 2014
NERON

So much fail at once...

  • Freida was active in the very beginning so we assumed she would continue to log in, if not frequently. She did not.
  • With <10 Ian found a planet with seismic and o2. The problem was, Jin Su had to deal with RL stuff and had to leave the game [thus not passing on the title right away by becoming idle from start]. Chun was only active enough to pick up the hacker kit in the beginning and not much else.
  • After much debate, we decide to kill Jin Su... who was declared idle the cycle after we began hitting him.
  • Chun then blurts out "GUYS! PLANET WITH O2 DIRECTION SOUTH, FUEL REQUIRED 5!", drops the hacker kit and returns to being idle
  • Jin Su's idleness made Roland captain [because of idles and stabby fun].
    Roland was active in the very beginning so we assumed he would continue to log in, if not frequently. He did not.
    He was, however outside so after more debate we had to leave him.
  • Even though all we knew about Chun's planet was that it had o2, we went to that one over Ian's because his had a 100% chance of an undesirable zone. Unfortunately, when we got there, we found out Chun's planet did not in fact contain o2.
  • The end.

On may 6, 2014
[7950824]

Suicide under any circumstances, at any time, is against the game rules. You might or might not get caught, but it's considered punishable at all times - the only grey area for that is when your risk of death (or certain death) actually improves the chances of the rest of the crew for survival.

An example of that would be when the ship must move this cycle to escape hunters/reach a planet with O2, it -can- move this cycle, except for one or more aracks. And a player uses their AP to kill those aracks in a fighter, but doesn't have enough AP left to land, and the ship lacks magnetic net, which would land the player safely when the ship moves...

The player made moving the ship possible, prolonging everyone's lives, but was unable to also return to the ship and could not have changed that - the player is safely in that grey area and would not be sanctioned even if reported (given that what I described were indeed the actual facts).

See, it's not over yet. Those other actives you mentioned? Any of them could log in at any time. They need you and you need them. That's your ship.

Play it out, that's what ships are for.

If you want more opinions, use the search function. The forums are full of people explaining this about suicide, even when you're the last one alive aboard.
On may 6, 2014
[7950824]

And voluntary conversion's also against the rules, alas. Gotta play for your team, not the other team.

And the cat torned him apart, when he tried to caress him. Schrödinger just finished humanity.

THE PLAN
1) do Xyloph databases to get technician mage book
2) rush pilgred / shoot aracks
3) do any research (glory w00t), preferably cure.
4) Bail to sol
WHAT HAPPENED
1) do xyloph databases, get tech book
2) rush pilgred (takes a few days)
3) we get PILGRED to 85% D5C2
4) 96%!! D5C3 NO ARACKS
5) need more AP
6) he goes to dorm
7) we agree to finish it on D5C5

Got caught in the act of trapping a shelf.

I had ingratiated myself with Jin Su, and we were operating nice and dandy to relay 6 fuel into the engine room for a planet jump. I was dirty and had extracted two spores under the cover of extracting fuel. I was set up to hit Jin Su with a spore and trap the engine room when he fueled up. He was even ready to give me a mission to help with the refueling.

Only problem-I trapped what was visibly an empty room, not realizing that the room logs reflected that Jin Su had entered the room and slammed home three fuel before my trap attempt. He had a laggy connection, and my Mush client obviously didn't feel it was important to physically display Jin Su just because he was, you know, in the room.

End result-I went from being in prime position to land a double sporing on an active Jin Su on Day 1 to getting outed for visibly trapping-all due to a 2 minute window overlap.

After that, I tossed a nade into a crowded Bravo Dorm, but that was really just for show. I was sunk and dead by Day 1. Oh wells

[8247402]

Soo, this is my first time playing as an Alpha Mush, and first time playing as a Mush entirely and my partner isn't communicating with me very much, they seemed to go inactive a lot. However, this fail is entirely on me, twice over and maybe more so.

I go on an expo, and I take traitor with me as one of my skills, unfortunately I jumped the gun and started the expo early, drawing suspicion on me immediately since Someone who was active with me still had their walkie on them. Now the expo begins and I am immediately taking all the damage from the Traitor effect, but I manage to survive, by 1 HP.

So I go and hurry to the medlab to try and self heal and take the bed, but along the way I get the bright idea that I can extra a spore...not my smartest move. I check Bravo Bay for an Alarm, and find one, then I pick it up, knowing that it won't work while in my inventory, and I extract a spore. That's when it hits me that I've dun goofed. So I quickly run to the refractory to get some more AP so I go beserk and at least kill gioele in the medlab. I eat the ration and immediately realize that I don't get AP from food either...

Now the other active player at this moment is asking me why I'm in the research lab and not medlab at this point. I effectively decided to spore the cat, but forgot they hadn't taken the other mycoalarm.

In the span of 2 minutes, literally, I ruined my chances at a long game. total and complete Fail on my part, with a capital F.
On may 19, 2014
[1757645]

Heh, panicking has caused me lot of problems also.

On my last ship, I was an Eleesha Alpha MUSH. I had managed to spore someone Derek early.
Then, me and my partner (Ian) agree to wait until an expo. We were going to kill Chun, and use the Hacker Kit to move the ship destroying the Icarus and killing it's crew. (Ian had Biologist and not Botanist.)

So, they finally get an expo started, and I load a fuel, grab a knife and blaster that was conveniently left in the Dorm with me, and head to the Lab to kill Chun.

So, here I am with two spores, a knife, blaster and about 10 AP. Chun has the armor, but that's not going to stop my onslaught! So, I fire once with the blaster. Miss. Okay, whatever, I fire again.

And get an injury! MASHED HAND +2 AP per action and -40% accuracy! Fffff---

Well, I am now outed and Ian can't help due to his special ability. So, I run to the MedLab and heal myself once to try to remove the injury. (Note: Only surgery can do that and that needs the bed. Which Ian was in. Plus it takes +2 AP to lie down now.)

Well, that doesn't work. I go back to the Lab, and figure I should at least weaken her some more. Maybe Ian can finish her off. I fire again. Miss. Then eat a spore and use my knife. (1 damage, I'm later told.)

Wait, is that Derek? Derek, the guy I had already spored is in the Lab! I could Transfer into him! Duh, why didn't I think of this before. Well, I only have 1 AP left, so I need more, and I have a spore. I'll just eat it.
Except my mashed hand has made it cost 2 AP to eat a spore. And I only have 1 AP...

That's when Chun notices. (Well, they manage to kill me. But I found the Grenade and told Ian. He did manage to use it, and later transferred into Derek, so not a total loss. Still it could have been so much more if I just didn't panic form being injured.)

On may 24, 2014
npfan
rook42Third time this EXACT thing has happened. I'm worried people are making new accounts just to do this kind of crap. Does twinoid allow proxy connections or something? Is there any way to prevent it from the player side, without "playing against your team" when you kill the useless folks?

You're allowed to kill Super Inactive characters, i.e. people who haven't been online for over 48 hours. If you know a player is active but is doing nothing useful, you can kill them because they're 'actively' playing against your team by purposely being unproductive.
On may 24, 2014
DarkTheRaven
SpazticusNo, that's not how the report system works. It's never worked that way. Reports aren't even seen until after a ship ends.

Wait... I've been sanctioned when a ship is still going, I was dead, but the ship itself was fine, is it because i was dead?
On may 24, 2014
[7950824]
DarkTheRavenWait... I've been sanctioned when a ship is still going, I was dead, but the ship itself was fine, is it because i was dead?

Reports from a ship get seen after said ship is dead. Players stuck with an actual or possible griefer on their ship are adrift; they must handle that situation themselves, for that ship. Help will not come, there is no one to ask or inform who will fix the problems for the players while that ship lives.

Assuming at least one player aboard that griefed or possibly griefed ship reports the questionable or horrible player, after that ship has died or returned to sol, or gone to Eden, then the report(s) can be viewed by Judges. The judges review the ship in light of the reported player and in consideration of the rules and pass judgement. Takes more than one verdict for whatever to happen, and there's consideration usually for how newbie someone is or whatever too.

But it can take a couple weeks or so for the verdict to be finalized, and the warning or quarantine to happen. By then the player may be on a different ship; if there is a quarantine the player is immediately killed (maybe at cycle change, only seen one quarantine myself).

The only thing you get to know for sure, it was not the current crew you were playing with or any current action on that live ship that triggered the warning or punishment. It's for stuff already done, on one or more ships.
On may 25, 2014
Sekai

Why are we discussing about sanctions in the Fail Thread? Did the Mods fail at sanctioning?
On may 25, 2014
[6826491]

It's being discussed, in part because you posted this incorrect information: I think you can mass report him and he'll be quarantined in that ship after some cycles.

On june 3, 2014
spacekadt

Let me set the scene for you. It's toward the end of day 20. We finally got our second piece of starmap on the first expo to a 20 zone planet that has Cristalite (where we found it) and 3 Intelligent Life zones (one of which we hit in the first expo).

Roland comes along and arranges for a heal since he's low on health and launches expo #2. This is a good thing! But by the time the expo is over, poor Roland is at 2 hp.

I had *just* woken up as the expo was ending and was going to heal Roland and figure out what zones were left on the planet and whether we needed to re-launch for a third expo. I first checked from my phone before even getting out of bed (nope, I'm not addicted. not at all!) then started checking the zones when I got to my computer a few minutes later.

Just as I'm about to pick up the medikit to give Roland a heal, the cycle changes. And the room shakes. And Roland dies.

Normally my obsessive spreadsheeting keeps people alive. This time it killed someone. I'm SO sorry Roland... I had no idea we were that close to a cycle change.

On june 5, 2014
[7947444]

My epic fail happened some months ago... and only with sharing my epic fail can I ever hope to close this door to my tortured past.

It all started on day one when I awoke as Agent of Mush. Over the next three days, my partner and I studied the patterns of life of our enemies. We discovered their log on times, their movements, their competency.... everything about them. We quickly determined that we would be able to decimate the ships moral and efficiency by knocking out three of the crew.

We got our break on Day 4 when all three of our high pay off targets happened to all be sleeping in Bravo Dorm along with a few other worthless meat bags. Armed with blasters, knives, and grenades, we stormed Bravo Dorm like a pair of navy seals. My initial grenade kills two, and a few knife slashes kill two more. Our plan had gone off without a hitch and we were know killing off several secondary targets.

Now covered in blood and foaming at the mouth like a mad berserker, I head to Alpha dorm to see what I can kill there. I slash out at each of the sleeping humans in the room to prevent them gaining additional AP from sleeping. I realize, I don't have the AP to put any more of them into the ground, but I do have the ability to transfer into one of them. Good idea right? Maybe I might catch a lucky break and they might kill the poor sap in my body before anyone realizes what had happened.

If only I was so lucky. I ended up transferring into somebody with 0 moral. I died the next cycle.

The only one who had issue with this was Derek who would rather try gambling with Neron upgrades and hope we would get magnetic net. When he realized we weren't taking that chance he buggered off to stand in a fire and try to solve the Kube.

Have you ever seen the movie Battle Royale? It was a lot like that. Everyone just started killing each other. First it was the inactives - Stephen and Gioele. Then the slightly less active Paola and Jin Su. Then all bets were off.

Chun murdered Kuan Ti. Roland murdered Hua. I murdered Derek. Everyone pitched in to help kill Roland. Then Chun and Raluca commited suicide due to morale loss while everyone tried killing Ian.

When the ship finally blew up the mush turned out to be an Andie who, while verbally active, kept a fairly low profile. It's ironic that the Mush didn't actually kill a single person directly, it was all the humans doing. I think that counts for a group fail for all the humans on board.

Armor does reduce damage on expos, but only from fights, not accident or fatigue... just like it reduces damage on the Daedalus, but only from combat sources, not from plates, shakes, fires, or spikes.

- Takes a day to get it connected again, the cycle we get it connected 15 hunters show up. Thankfully(surprisingly) our pilots manage to take all of them out.

On june 28, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Were you on the same ship as Isidarth ?

Once as mush Eleesha, most of the active crew members (including, IIRC, Janice, Chao and Jin Su) had gone to an expedition without securing the hacker kit. So of course I grabbed it, loaded one fuel, rushed to the bridge, and... realized just in time that I couldn't do anything, because they had waited too long before launching, and an arack had appeared at cycle change.

That was the first of a nice series of expedition fails on that ship, but fortunately, the rest were mostly human fails.

During the expedition, they saw that someone had loaded one fuel, so I told them that I had picked up the hacker kit "to keep it safe" and had loaded fuel so that we'd be ready to leave orbit when they came back. And... they believed me and didn't kill me.

A few days later, they got ready for another expedition. If all had gone as planned, all the active humans (Janice, Chao, Hua, Roland, Frieda and Ian) would have gone down to the planet, leaving Chun alone with five mush. Eventually, Chao and Ian didn't go and, for some reason that I still don't understand to this day, mush Stephen decided to go to Icarus bay.

None of them realized that there were so many mush, but they did know that there were at least two living mush on a very active ship, and yet once again they didn't secure the hacker kit... and they left the commander on board. Who, of course, had been converted.

I guess that it taught them a lesson about basic precautions before an expedition...
On june 28, 2014
Kyubey

Ian has healed 3 hp for Jin Su. 50min
Ian has managed to cure Jin Su of their disease (Gastroenteritis). 50min and at last allowed to be healed
Jin Su is lying down... It's good to just stop and take a break. Destination : the land of dreams! 51min
Jin Su has dropped the Schrödinger. 51min
You have lost 2 hp. 51min at last!
That wasn't supposed to happen. In the heat of the action you hurt yourself... 51min
Jin Su has picked up the Schrödinger. 51min

3 minutes of picking-dropping Schrödinger, something like 30 attempts

Jin Su wakes up calmly... 54min
Jin Su has dropped the Schrödinger. 59min
Jin Su gave Schrödinger a big cuddle, much to his displeasure, but in any case it always makes people feel better... 59min
You have earned 3 moral. 59min
Jin Su has picked up the Schrödinger.

Why random damage happen so often when you don't want...and it takes so long to throw poor cat across the room to get it when you want to?

From 0100-0500 we wait for the RNG to give us selections that consist of more than 2 characters so we don't end up on a full ship. 0500, he jumps onto an empty ship again and we had to wait for it to fill up. 0500-1100, only 3 people join the ship, I assume because it's the middle of the night for Europe. Starting 1100, I take some 1h naps because I needed to sleep. 1500 he starts taking the 1h naps because he still needs to report the roster. 1600-2300 the ship fills up faster but my selection never lands on the same characters. 2300 the ship is full. How many hours is that?

Well I think mine will be an all time epic fail tale told for generations to come. Currently playing on a ship as Stephen with a bronze skill of Solid. Mush number one fell quickly to me as it was Paola and she wasn't doing her job. We were not sure she was Mush mind you but Chun and others agreed she should be removed so that Eleesha could inherit her job. So I killed the first Alpha Mush. Then I went away to watch the world cup game in RL between Netherlands and Argentina. When I came back to the game the main chat had a kill Janice on sight order as apparently she went on a rampage and tried to kill Chun and another crew member. As it turns out I failed to read the private chat line (by know I was a trusted human since I had killed Mush#1). Anyway I executed Janice (Alpha Mush#2). Or at least she was up to about one minute before I killed her. Turns out our Raluca was a Genius and had done the Retrofungal Serum and had just turned Janice into a human. Talk about missing the boat people. Anyway I am being called some seriously bad names on the ship at the moment as I have kind of upset our karmic harmony. Now here comes the ironic part. We are still voyaging and guess who is now the only shrink on board? Yes it is me courtesy of a Mage book. So my penance is to serve as a shrink on this ship even though they told me I get no sex and must eat bananas. Jin Su is so mad he plans to boycott speechs if I am present. Anybody got a better fail than this one. Talk about not reading chat and miserably bad timing!
On july 10, 2014
npfan

FYI, if you become low in morale, there's no other way to raise morale other than from Jin Su or doing the thing, and they choose not to help, you can report them and they can be sanctioned.

It is important to "read before doing" in mush. Because plans can change on the fly, Thanks for that FatalAttraction!

The idea was for him to share his story, of not paying attention and acting too fast without situation assessment. Which in turn cost us one life of an highly active level 4 Gold crew member who would've been instrumental to furthering our cause. Of course we were angry, wouldn't you be? It's only ironic coincidence that he is the Shrink. Only because he was found to be the only trusted/tested human, he was allowed to read the Shrink Book as we noticed our Janice was acting strange. So in essence, Fatal already had become the Shrink, before killing her by mistake of not reading the crew chatter completely.

On july 12, 2014
[8356287]

My last ship was a murdership. 13/16 characters assassinated. It was my first time as Janice, and I was looking forward to some NERON role-play, but this ship was so brain-dead it would have been pointless.

We had this psychotic Paola who acted like she was 12 years old and kept whoring herself out to every guy for doing whatever she wanted. She had all these weird "rules", like automatic death sentence for dirty Ian. In day 2, she offered herself to Ian for moving a camera, and then to Derek to KILL Ian for being dirty, who tried and failed, and even then, she was STILL trying to get Ian to have sex with her. Then she accused Jin Su, and then proceeded to offer herself to him too, in exchange for a mission. (No, she wasn't Mush, just psycho.)

I'll be honest: when Ian was suspected, I asked him to convert me, because I was pretty sick of this ship and wanted to get it over with (in a fun way). Ian was great at role-play (pretty much the only one besides me), so I thought we'd make a good team for "purification." But he didn't convert me, so I assumed he wasn't Mush. (I was wrong about that, but whatevs.) So I negotiated to let Ian live if he showered and then remained confined to the Lab to tend plants and research. Of course, I was also suspect for helping him, but I couldn't reveal why I did.

Jin Su, Terrence and Gioele went on expedition and came back with heavy injuries and illness, so I spent a bunch of AP curing and healing them. Then they invited me to the Mush hunt private chat, and I admitted to them why I believed Ian wasn't Mush. (Stupid of me.)

So Jin Su was confirmed Human, but just a few cycles later he was walking around dirty, without ever announcing how he got dirty. Several of us called him on it, and he got all defensive and sarcastic, saying he got dirty by "extracting spores." I pointed out that he could have been infected after I cured his illness, and that his behavior was suspicious. And he immediately stabbed me to death for saying that. Then there was a huge blood bath.

And then I got reported for "inciting another crew member to spoil the game." It's true, I broke a rule by asked to be converted, but believe me, I wasn't the one that spoiled this game...

http://mush.twinoid.com/theEnd/4708
