On july 24, 2014
Ferhago

Now, here's a tale from the other side: http://mush.vg/theEnd/46965

I decide to pick KT, a nice and boring character for a game where I won't be communicating much. My first act was to move to the Nexus and wait for a relay. I expected a Mush to come by and spike me, but for some reason 4 different people came by without doing anything.
That was strange, but it was only a taste of the nonsense to come from my French crewmates.

I head back to the dorm, and then a few hours later someone uses Mass Moisification. That's a skill that requires a lot of finesse to use well; the Mush here had none of that. I immediately point out that Ian, Raluca, and Derek were the only people who could have even extracted the spores to use it in the first place. Everyone else was under a camera or standing with a group. Raluca and Ian were Gold, so they were the serious suspects. Derek was Bronze, so I didn't think it was him. Who's ever heard of a genuinely Bronze level 18 Mush? Raluca was inactive, though Gold, so I say that Ian has to be the one. Ian denied it, of course, but I added that Ian was one of the people to visit me in the Nexus, and he was Dirty when he did it. And why else would he wait in RC until day change, if not to extract more spores?

Well no one believed me. I pushed the issue, but others defended him. Still, strange Ian-related events continued to occur over the next two days. Research, for instance, had been painfully slow, thanks to no one having found the apron. On a random hunch, I visit one of the storage units...and the apron is just sitting right on the shelf. Then I announce that the only two people who had been in the unit were Jin Su, who was inactive...and Ian. "Come on" I thought "surely they're going to kill him now?". Two cycles later, Derek kills Jin Su. >_<

It was really hard to follow anything after that, but somehow 8 more people died and we found out the Alpha Mush had been Roland and, of course, Ian. At this point, Janice started to act really odd. We were all suffering from low morale, but no matter how many times we asked she never comforted anyone. Andie died from Morale, Chun died from morale, and I was pretty close to dying too. And while all this is going on, Janice is active and choosing to spend her time sitting in the Medlab instead of a dorm. >_< >_< >_<

Meanwhile, our hull was quickly disappearing since we never had anyone to complete Plasma Shield. Frieda lucked into a small planet with 02, and was able to pick up some more by herself. We also found that our starting Mage Book was for Technician. I nabbed it, load fuel so we can flee the hunters, and then me and Terrence started relaying Pilgred up from 30%. By stuffing ourselves with food, we were able to finish it a day later. For a second, it looks like we're actually going to win?

At this point, Frieda and Terrence are ready to go home; there were only five of us left, since so many have died from morale. My vote made a majority decision. But then it hit me: Janice was still alive. The only reason I'm alive is because she crawled into a bed near me, at random, giving me just enough morale to survive the last day change. All the plants were dead, no one ever gave a speech or completed the important rebel bases. There was no way she could still be alive, if she were human; her morale should have ran out a long time ago. There were other clues too; she made a point of emphasizing that Ian was the last Mush when they were killing him; she stayed dirty; and I didn't notice this until later, but she was in the Medlab when Andie died of Depression. I quickly ask Frieda to wait before taking us back, pointing out that Janice should be dead from morale. And it seems to work? 20 minutes go by and Frieda doesn't move. But unfortunately I'm low on AP from repairing PILGRED and I can't find a weapon. But then in lieu of a response, Frieda pushes the button, we're back home and Janice has successfully infiltrated Sol. Mush win.
>_< x infinity.
On july 24, 2014
[8202554]
Ferhago

Now, here's a tale from the other side: http://mush.vg/theEnd/46965

I decide to pick KT, a nice and boring character for a game where I won't be communicating much. My first act was to move to the Nexus and wait for a relay. I expected a Mush to come by and spike me, but for some reason 4 different people came by without doing anything.
That was strange, but it was only a taste of the nonsense to come from my French crewmates.

I head back to the dorm, and then a few hours later someone uses Mass Moisification. That's a skill that requires a lot of finesse to use well; the Mush here had none of that. I immediately point out that Ian, Raluca, and Derek were the only people who could have even extracted the spores to use it in the first place. Everyone else was under a camera or standing with a group. Raluca and Ian were Gold, so they were the serious suspects. Derek was Bronze, so I didn't think it was him. Who's ever heard of a genuinely Bronze level 18 Mush? Raluca was inactive, though Gold, so I say that Ian has to be the one. Ian denied it, of course, but I added that Ian was one of the people to visit me in the Nexus, and he was Dirty when he did it. And why else would he wait in RC until day change, if not to extract more spores?

Well no one believed me. I pushed the issue, but others defended him. Still, strange Ian-related events continued to occur over the next two days. Research, for instance, had been painfully slow, thanks to no one having found the apron. On a random hunch, I visit one of the storage units...and the apron is just sitting right on the shelf. Then I announce that the only two people who had been in the unit were Jin Su, who was inactive...and Ian. "Come on" I thought "surely they're going to kill him now?". Two cycles later, Derek kills Jin Su. >_<

It was really hard to follow anything after that, but somehow 8 more people died and we found out the Alpha Mush had been Roland and, of course, Ian. At this point, Janice started to act really odd. We were all suffering from low morale, but no matter how many times we asked she never comforted anyone. Andie died from Morale, Chun died from morale, and I was pretty close to dying too. And while all this is going on, Janice is active and choosing to spend her time sitting in the Medlab instead of a dorm. >_< >_< >_<

Meanwhile, our hull was quickly disappearing since we never had anyone to complete Plasma Shield. Frieda lucked into a small planet with 02, and was able to pick up some more by herself. We also found that our starting Mage Book was for Technician. I nabbed it, load fuel so we can flee the hunters, and then me and Terrence started relaying Pilgred up from 30%. By stuffing ourselves with food, we were able to finish it a day later. For a second, it looks like we're actually going to win?

At this point, Frieda and Terrence are ready to go home; there were only five of us left, since so many have died from morale. My vote made a majority decision. But then it hit me: Janice was still alive. The only reason I'm alive is because she crawled into a bed near me, at random, giving me just enough morale to survive the last day change. All the plants were dead, no one ever gave a speech or completed the important rebel bases. There was no way she could still be alive, if she were human; her morale should have ran out a long time ago. There were other clues too; she made a point of emphasizing that Ian was the last Mush when they were killing him; she stayed dirty; and I didn't notice this until later, but she was in the Medlab when Andie died of Depression. I quickly ask Frieda to wait before taking us back, pointing out that Janice should be dead from morale. And it seems to work? 20 minutes go by and Frieda doesn't move. But unfortunately I'm low on AP from repairing PILGRED and I can't find a weapon. But then in lieu of a response, Frieda pushes the button, we're back home and Janice has successfully infiltrated Sol. Mush win. :mush_no_mush_bar_1:
>_< x infinity.

[7947444]

This isn't so much my fail as it was another players, but I feel the story belongs here non-the-less.

Over several days I built what I thought to be a strong and convincing case against Eleesha that she was mush. The other players on the mush hunt were were pretty reserved to pull the trigger on taking her out. While they wait to catch her rand handed doing something mush like, she decides to go on a kill spree. But before doing so, she is smart enough to protect her other mush partner by printing the Mush List and shredding it. Well she stabs, shoots, and kills her way across the ship like a Navy Seal hell bent on bringing the ship down... but she only has moderate success. Well in her last effort, she transfers into my poor body and learns quickly that I had no AP. Lucky the crew is smart enough to see this and kills my old body. So now with the back story out of the way (and sorry if this is a bit anti-climatic) I head off to the bridge to print the list as Eleesha. I try to print the list, but I can't since it was already printed and shredded. This sucks I think to myself... but then I look back further in the room logs and notice that when she read the list it appears in the room logs. Well, with the people she killed, wounded, or already proven human we only had one suspect left on the list.

She did everything she could to cover destroy that list, but failed because of the transfer.

On my ship:

We suspected Andie for slowing research, but she made food-test and she said that she started the game with no AP, that was her excuse. Frieda seems to be newbie, but she her planets with o2 had also seismic activity, she found 3 planets with them. Janice started scanning and found safe o2 planet. We came there.

I was blind. Mush selection was on D1C7, but Eleesha was active on D1C4. It was D4C8. I thought she was a Mush. I took the medikit and found out that she didn't need to be healed. The other inactives needed it. I accused Eleesha for being Mush, I buried FC and CC to find the knife, which Chun held. I found just Hacker Kit and Myco-alarm. I left the Hacker Kit there as I thoght the Mush is inactive and went to the expedition.

The expedition had been started. A strange announcement sent NERON. The Daedalus changed heading. The commander was on the expedition with us. I thought Magnetic Return worked. We had 5 people on the expedition as Large Bay Upgrade had been made. But Magnetic Return doesn't work as we think. If someone had moved the Daedalus, we would have been died abandoned in the planet. What's happened?

Frieda used the Hacker Kit. Epic Fail! Frieda forgot that with fuel we won't leave the orbit. Changing heading doesn't mean anything. How to be caught? I buried the Hacker Kit thinking that the Mush was inactive, but Frieda was the Mush, but she didn't used that chance. She failed it!
On august 2, 2014
Sagittaeri

I just totally failed my mush rampage!

I was Mush Ian, and my mush partner got himself killed early on, the ship had like 5 Biologists, so RFS was researched pretty quickly. Due to an earlier fail with Green Jelly and MycoAlarm, I'm pretty much in the cross-hairs of the mush hunters with one other human. Plus the ship has a super active Chun and and super active Derek, so the timing of my rampage was crucial.

My plan:
(1) Wait till Chun and Derek are mostly offline
(2) Prepare Armor, 2 NCC Lenses and 2 Blasters
(3) Transfer into Derek
(4) Use 2 NCC Lenses + Blaster and free shooter points to kill one pilot (87% accuracy)
(5) Use Wrestler to kill the other pilot
(6) Let hunters destroy the ship! Win!

What REALLY happened:
(1) Derek only had 2 APs and 2 MPs. Ugh.
(2) My second attack (87%) missed, AND it caused a self-injury: Punctured Lung (which adds +2 APs to ALL actions, even dropping/picking up objects! On top of that I get -2 HP per cycle!)
(3) So, I'm stuck. With +2 APs to everything, I can't even use my free shooter points!
(4) I got RFS-ed before I managed to do any real damage.

So, yeah. XD

On august 5, 2014
Zeph

As for picking up items, what exactly is a breach of neutral play? If I'm one of the first ones to wake up I like to grab the knife if I see it. Will be useful to have if I'm either human or mush.

I can understand doing things like hiding items would be bad, but what's wrong with grabbing items you would want either way? Chun or otherwise?

Is it a breach of neutral play for Terrance to grab the scooter before mush are chosen? If not then I don't see how anything else would be.
On august 5, 2014
NERON

All those actions are considered broken neutral play

The point isn't to prevent either team from getting an unfair advantage. The point is to prevent individuals from getting the advantage.
You may be human or you may be mush but either way, you're going to have a better time than the rest of your crew just because you woke up sooner.

I think it's ok for people to hold items if the rest of the crew doesn't complain but if they do, you must drop your inventory.
On august 5, 2014
Chime

And hiding isn't possible before mush selection as of this season.
Besides, if you grab the Knife and then suddenly remember that your vacation starts tomorrow and you're gone for a week, they will have to kill you without the Knife to get the Knife. (Though.. Aprons are the usual reason to kill people... or Cameras, Pots, Extinguisher or the Wrench. My favourite in that department was a Paola killing a Terrence for carrying a Blueprint assuming it was her Sofa BP when in fact it was just his Drone BP... )

And just think of all those other people who love to carry the Knife and think a mush must have snatched if, if it's nowhere to be found.

Followed by an Eleesha seeing that you picked it up a long time ago. Swooosh. You're dead.
On august 5, 2014
[6826491]
ZephAs for picking up items, what exactly is a breach of neutral play?

It just so happens that I have clarified what is a breach of Neutral Play, and why Chun must follow it as well. It's in the first post in Ask the SDF! #2, with a followup post from me here as well.

In short, you may move items, but not hold them, because for the purposes of Neutral Play, holding items in your inventory is treated the same as hiding them (when that was still possible.) Consent of the crew does not make someone exempt, nor does RP count as an exemption, because there are no exemptions. Just because Derek has Shooter, that does not mean he can hold weapons before Mush selection. He can pick them up after the moment of Mush selection, with all the possible consequences that can imply.
On august 5, 2014
[1757645]

NERONThe point isn't to prevent either team from getting an unfair advantage. The point is to prevent individuals from getting the advantage.

No, it's to prevent either team from getting an advantage.

Why should you care if your MUSH partner has a weapon and you don't? It still helps you.
Why should you care if another human has a weapon and you don't? (Assuming you can trust them, but with conversions and transfers you can't really trust yourself.) It still helps you.

This is a team game, not an individual game.
